competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Hospitality & Tourism cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster.
Research a career in the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Hospitality & Tourism career cluster.
Lodging
Demonstrate an understanding of the lodging career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the lodging career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the lodging career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the lodging career pathway.
Research the history of the lodging career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the lodging career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the lodging career pathway.
Recreation, Amusements and Attractions
Demonstrate an understanding of the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Research the history of the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the recreation, amusements and attractions career pathway.
Restaurants and Food/Beverage Services
Demonstrate an understanding of the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Research the history of the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the restaurants and food/beverage services career pathway.
Practice safety, sanitation, and storage procedures in food preparation.
Demonstrate practices and procedures that assure personal and workplace health and hygiene.
Identify common food borne illnesses, their causes and symptoms.
Demonstrate ways to prevent food borne illnesses.
Identify and practice food service safety, storage and sanitation procedures.
Identify and demonstrate proper use of culinary equipment and tools.
Identify and demonstrate proper use of measuring utensils for the appropriate ingredient.
Identify and demonstrate proper and safe use and care of culinary tools.
Identify and demonstrate proper and safe use and care of culinary equipment.
Read and interpret a recipe accurately.
Demonstrate an understanding of the purpose and preparation of standardized recipes.
Define mise en place and the relationship of organizational skills to productivity.
Define and demonstrate common culinary terms used in recipes.
Apply common abbreviations and equivalents used in recipes.
Demonstrate recipe conversions.
Relate the principles of nutrition to menu development.
Describe the purpose of essential nutrients and list foods providing them.
Describe the food groups according to USDA Dietary Guidelines and the nutrients contained within each group.
Explain your district's and/or school's Wellness Policy.
Interpret the components of food labels and relationship to wellness.
Identify fad diets and how they affect overall nutrition.
Develop menus using various dietary guidelines (e.g. diabetic, vegan, gluten-free, etc.).
Develop menus that meet the special dietary needs of culinary customers.
Analyze factors that affect menu development.
Identify factors that affect menu planning (i.e. season, cultural influences, trends, and technology).
Analyze food costs and the impact on menu development (i.e. unit pricing, shipping cost, location).
Create a variety of menus for various types of culinary establishments.
Practice time management in the production of meal menus.
Demonstrate basic food preparation skills.
Demonstrate appropriate techniques for measuring and weighing.
Practice knife skills.
Demonstrate various cooking techniques.
Demonstrate ability to select, store, prepare, and serve nutritious and aesthetically pleasing food.
Exhibit efficient operation of the back-of-the-house.
Define back-of-the-house.
Identify the back-of-the-house preparation stations.
Demonstrate the culinary duties and responsibilities of back-of-the-house staff.
Follow industry guidelines for appropriate dress for back-of-the-house staff.
Identify technology utilized in the back-of-the-house culinary industry (i.e. thermocirculator, point-of-sale, etc.).
Exhibit efficient operation of the front-of-the-house.
Define front-of-the-house.

Identify and demonstrate the culinary duties and responsibilities of front-of-the-house staff (i.e. table set up, accurate recording of customer requests, appropriate serving techniques,  money collection, etc.).
Follow industry guidelines for appropriate dress for front-of-the-house staff.
Analyze the impact of the employees' attitude, appearance, and actions on customer satisfaction.
Apply concepts of quality service to ensure customer satisfaction.
Identify technology utilized in the culinary industry (i.e. point of sale, inventory controls, etc.).
Demonstrate creative food presentation techniques.
Identify criteria for achieving an aesthetically pleasing plate.
Conduct sensory evaluations of plated presentations.
Demonstrate plated presentations.
Practice various garnishing techniques utilizing a variety of garnishing tools to achieve an edible centerpiece.
Demonstrate the skills involved in self-sustainability as it relates to food.
Identify the importance of seasonality of foods.
Distinguish seasonal food pricing in relation to menu planning.
Identify ways to preserve food (i.e. canning, frozen, dehydrated, etc.).
Develop a food budget, distinguishing between processed and scratch-made foods.
Establish and care for a seasonal garden.
Analyze the relationship between resources and attainment of lifestyle.
Travel and Tourism
Demonstrate an understanding of the travel and tourism career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the travel and tourism career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the travel and tourism career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the travel and tourism career pathway.
Research the history of the travel and tourism career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the travel and tourism career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the travel and tourism career pathway.
Define the different types of tourism within the industry.
Demonstrate an understanding of the cruise line industry career pathway.
Discuss the establishment and history of the cruise industry.
Describe some of the careers available in the cruise industry career pathway.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the cruise industry career pathway.
Describe technologies related to careers within the cruise industry career pathway.
Identify terminology used in the cruise industry.
Demonstrate an understanding of different cultures as they relate to the travel/tourism industry.
Identify major characteristics of a country’s culture.
Demonstrate knowledge of the food/beverage service industry in other countries.
Demonstrate knowledge of the lodging service industry in other countries.
Demonstrate knowledge of the recreation, amusements and attractions industry in other countries.
Demonstrate knowledge of the travel/tourism industry in other countries.
